name: Lethal yellowing
summary: Lethal yellowing is a phytoplasma disease affecting palms, characterized by the yellowing of leaves, premature fruit drop, and eventual death of the tree if untreated.

cause_of_disease.describe: Lethal yellowing is caused by a specific type of phytoplasma, a bacterial parasite that affects the vascular system of palms.
The phytoplasma is primarily spread by insect vectors, with the coconut palm-specific planthopper (Haplaxius crudus) being a notable carrier.
Environmental factors such as poor soil quality and lack of nutrients can increase the susceptibility of palms to the disease.

Safely remove and destroy them to prevent further spread

tips: Regularly inspect palms for early signs of disease to ensure prompt treatment.
Plant resistant varieties of palms when possible to reduce the risk of infection.
Maintain good soil quality and provide adequate nutrition to strengthen palm trees against potential infections.
